metadata.description: The Azure location for the connected cluster.  For example, East US.
The ARM name for the Microsoft.Kubernetes/connectedClusters resource that the configuration will be created on.
The name for the sourceControlConfiguration.  Learn more about setting up GitOps configuration: https://aka.ms/AzureArcK8sUsingGitOps.

The name of the operator associated with this configuration. The instance name can contain up to 353 lower-case alphanumeric characters, hyphen, or period. If enableHelmOperator is true, then operatorInstanceName + operatorNamespace strings cannot exceed 47 characters combined.

The namespace to use for the configuration operator. The namespace can contain up to 353 lower-case alphanumeric characters, hyphen, or period. If enableHelmOperator is true, then operatorInstanceName + operatorNamespace strings cannot exceed 47 characters combined.
The permission scope for the operator. Possible values are 'cluster' (full access) or 'namespace' (restricted access).
The type of operator to install. Currently, 'Flux' is supported.
Parameters to set on the Flux operator, separated by spaces.  For example, --git-readonly --git-path=namespaces,workloads.  Learn more: http://aka.ms/AzureArcK8sFluxOperatorParams.
The URL for the source control repository. Private repo: git@github.com:Contoso/cluster-config
Indicate whether to enable Helm for this instance of Flux. Learn more: http://aka.ms/AzureArcK8sGitOpsWithHelm.

metadata.displayName: Helm chart version for installing Flux Helm
metadata.description: The version of the Helm chart for installing Flux Helm.  For example, 0.6.0

metadata.displayName: Helm chart parameters for installing Flux Helm
metadata.description: Parameters for the Helm chart for installing Flux Helm, separated by spaces.

resources.comments: Create a source control configuration for the connected cluster.
resources.name: [concat(parameters('clusterName'), '/Microsoft.KubernetesConfiguration/', parameters('configurationResourceName'))]
